result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Mark Richard Stewart was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Mark Richard Stewart in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Attorney General Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case manager Steven Johnson from WCS also in court.  Case calendared for doctor's report return.  Parties have received and reviewed the report.  Defendant does not contest findings.  The Court accepts the conclusions in the report and the conditional release plan.  The case manager from WCS is to submit a proposed written plan stating the conditions of the plan to the Court.  The defendant is to comply in it's entirety with the written conditions from WCS along with the following:  take all prescribed medications, keep all appointments with the WCS team, doctor's and counselors, follow through on any treatment given, absolutely no contact with Judge Yamahiro or his family at his home, courthouse or anywhere, meet casemanager at all times set, abstain from alcohol and controlled substances for the entire commitment, before taking any dietary supplements, consult with a team member for approval.  For any non-compliance, defendant will be taken into custody and serve the remainder of the 4 year sentence in an institution.  Order filed and signed.
Doctor's Report Return on March 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
(DUPLICATE) WCS Predisposition Investigation, received and filed.
WCS Predisposition Investigation, received and filed.
Doctor's Report Return at 03-15-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Mark Richard Stewart in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp. 
Case set for return on doctor's report. Parties are not challening the findings of the report and request to proceed with the special plea today. Plea hearing proceeded.

PHASE I:
As to COUNT 1-
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
 
PHASE II:
As to COUNT 1-
Court finds defendant suffered from a mental disease at the time of the offense and was unable to appreciate the wrongfulness of hisconduct and unable to conform his behavior to the requirements of the law.  Court finds the defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court enters judgment that the defendant is not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. Additional statements made by Steven B.

Court orders defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services forthwith for a period of 4 YEARS. Order for Commitment (CR-271) signed and filed.

The Court has concerns if he should be committed or if he can reside in the community under a Conditional Release Order or if he should be committed under institutional care.  The Court ordered a Predisposition Investigation. Order for Predisposition Investigation (CR-272) signed and filed.

Case adjourned to Branch 21. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mark Richard Stewart in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Mark Richard Stewart in custody.  Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Defense is no longer contesting the Doctors Report dated 04/03/2015.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 22.  Competency hearing scheduled for 05/19/2015 is vacated.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
